title: Cafeteria Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively standard. No curve balls. Direct questions and non intimidating employees. Flexible meeting times and understanding of student schedules. Quick interview and informative. Overall a good experience.

title: Office Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was informal and low pressure. Just came in and answered some questions. Semi-formal dress suggested but not required. I suggest you apply in person, much of office work is people skills, so being able to display that is important.
Interview Questions: How you ever worked in an office before?

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM)
Interview Descriptions: Very loose informal process. Involved simple question pertaining to IT/Computer experience. System building experience seems invaluable when interviewing. There was a brief discussion on compensation. It was stated that compensation would be low but employment would be stable. This process is only relevant to students at the college.
Interview Questions: What IT experience do you have?

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: scheduled a day for the interview. First round- formal interview with director, assoc director and supervisor. Second round - informal round with other co workers.  total interview was for 4 hours. gave the decision after one and half months.
Interview Questions: how will you respond in stressful situation.

title: Associate Grant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Resume, cover letter, and three letters of recommendation required for HR. Once HR approved application, it was forwarded to department Director. One-on-one interview with Director. Question process reasonable length and conversational.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an unfamiliar situation - for example, while you're alone in the department, a student comes in and asks for assistance with a registration issue.

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I asked the student employment office where to apply and they said several departments are hiring. I went to the MechE department then to the math department where I was hired

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: there was no interview for this position. The professor chose me because I excelled at the subject. I am sure this is how professors chose most of their teacher assistants at new mexico tech. The more you excel at the subject the better.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech
Interview Descriptions: Walked in one day and filled out the paperwork and was basically hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: Can you provide some examples of the work you have done in Excel?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview started off normally with a phone interview over basic attributes and personality questions, then there was a drug test, after the drug test was a panel interview, followed by a one on one interview. All in all, a pretty straightforward process. I was also told during the interview a background check would be done.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to New Mexico Tech?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Mexico Tech (Socorro, NM) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was easy i walked in the professor's office and asked him if he had funding for the following years. He said yes the might have something , i handed my resume and 3 weeks letter i got a call for an interview. I came to his office and he questioned me about my laboratory skills and computer skills. A week later i got an email informing me that i got the job.
Interview Questions: have you had any lab safety training ?
